reviewText:
The major message is that the quest for utopia usually has terror as at least one way station.

It would probably be worthwhile to scan the Wikipedia entries for the major characters and concepts.

This course would be improved by more and better graphics and videos. Otherwise, I'd assign five stars.

This course should be required of all midshipmen, cadets, seminarians, and others following paths of righteousness.

https://www.amazon.com/review/create-review/ref=cm_cr_dp_d_wr_but_top?ie=UTF8&channel=glance-detail&asin=B00E87DB0M#
This is a very good course, as expected.
Excellent Course - and received quickly and precisely as advertised.

Our professor knows his subject and presents it in an engaging and informative way.  We are thoroughly enjoying this course and have learned many new things about the two world wars and the internal strife of the countries in involved and the goals of their leaders.  It's a theme that is still playing out today, especially in current events.
